="preserve">Croton-on-Hudson is a village in Westchester County, New York, United States. The population was 8,070 at the 2010 census. It is in the town of Cortlandt as part of New York City's northern suburbs. The village was incorporated in 1898.
Croton-on-Hudson is the original home of the Hudson Institute, a key Cold War think tank where the justification for nuclear war was developed.
